channel.title: Concerts/Live Music
channel.description:
We have a now playing thread, but what about live music aka the best kind? A place to discuss their favorite live bands/musicians, shows seen live, and any upcoming tours.
I guess I can start off.
I have seen a few bands live, Pretty much all after I graduated High School and moved to a city that bands bother coming near.
Seen: (trying to stay in order, my favorites are in [b]BOLD[/b] [b]Goatwhore The Acacia Strain[/b] The Devil Wears Prada The Number 12 Looks Like You [b]Amon Amarth[/b] (met them after the show and had them sign my concert booklet) [b]Darkest Hour[/b] (met them with Amon Amarth) Chimaira (Twice) Job For a Cowboy (Three times, terrible each time) Every Time I Die Shadows Fall Gwar Light This City The Deep All That Remains (Twice) [b]Animosity [/b](Twice) First Blood For the Fallen Dreams All Shall Perish Hate Eternal Veil of Maya [b]Beneath The Massacre[/b] Dying Fetus [b]Necrophagist[/b] Divine Heresy As I Lay Dying (Twice) August Burns Red Annotations of an Autopsy Evergreen Terrace 36 Crazy Fists Trivium (Probably the WORST band I have ever seen, I walked out) The Human Abstract (Twice) [b]Protest The Hero[/b] MyChildren MyBride [b]Opeth Enslaved[/b] [b]Clutch Baroness[/b] (my buddy and I were probably the only 2 people at the show who knew who Baroness were.) Lionize No Quarter (Led Zepplin tribute band) [b]Obscura[/b] Neuraxis The Faceless (twice) Cannibal Corpse (I am the proud owner of a drum stick thrown into the crowd during the encore) 3 Inches of Blood [b]Between the Buried and Me In Flames Torche The Dillinger Escape Plan [/b]
Best show was probably the Opeth and Enslaved show last spring. The black metal band Wolves in the Throne Room showed up and were set to play but they couldn't fit their set list in with the time constraints. I got to meet them otherwise, the show blew my mind.
Upcoming shows: Just bought my ticket the other day for: Megadeth, Testament and Exodus. Show is in March.

They pretty much all do around here.

item.title: Concerts/Live Music
item.dc:creator: Level
item.description:
Arch Enemy

They came to my city last night. I was laughing at all the metalheads. They all looked the same, wearing black with metal T-shirts, the occasional pink mohawk. Funny stuff.

I’m not really one to talk though, I was running around in my boxers in protest of our increased tuition.

Read full topic

item.title: Concerts/Live Music
item.dc:creator: Johnny_X
item.description:
Too many to mention… getting on for 30 years ago I used to supplement my beer money as a student by working at venues around the midlands in the UK either selling programmes or roadying.

Some of note to pull out of the list…

Led Zep at Knebworth 1979
Pink Floyd doing The Wall at Earls Court 1980
The Who at the NEC B/ham 1981 (although I went specifically to see the support band, a RnB group called 9 Below Zero)
The Honeydrippers (Robert Plants RnB band) North Staffs Poly - spent the night getting drunk with RP after that one)
Queen at Milton Keynes Bowl in 81 or 82

Memorable ones at the Poly in the early 80’s

Angelic Upstarts - riot ensued, poly smashed up.
Dexys Midnight Runners - riot ensued, Kevin Rowlands got smashed up
Toyah Wilcox - Toyah strips, riot ensues…

Last gig I went to was to see the Fun Lovin Criminals in Manchester 5 or 6 years ago. One of the best live bands I’ve ever seen.

Read full topic

item.title: Concerts/Live Music

item.description:
Patonki:

Holy shit definitely would’ve wanted to see that
how were they?

Faaaaaantastic. They were opening for Billy Talent, and I didn’t know who they were before that but when I heard them, I loved them.

item.description:
I haven’t seen a live show since Pantera, Soulfly, Morbid Angel, and Nothingface back in November/December of 2000…

I’ll put together a more involved list of who I have seen tomorrow or something.

Read full topic

item.title: Concerts/Live Music
item.dc:creator: danielsangeo
item.description:
In Order:

J. Geils Band
Janet Jackson

Then, beginning in 1996, I began attending something called the HFStival, an annual festival of alternative rock.

In no particular order by year (the ones I bothered to watch):
1996
Foo Fighters, Presidents of the United States of America, Jewel, Everclear, No Doubt, Jimmie’s Chicken Shack, Dishwalla, Garbage, Jewel

1997
Beck, Jamiroquai, Echo and the Bunnymen(!), Blondie(!!), Mighty Mighty Bossotones, Squirrel Nut Zippers, Reel Big Fish, Soul Coughing

1998
Crystal Method, Green Day, B-52s, Foo Fighters, Barenaked Ladies, Marcy Playground, Mighty Mighty Bosstones, Everclear

1999
Limp Bizkit, Chemical Brothers, Red Hot Chili Peppers, Moby, Blink 182, Offspring, Goo Goo Dolls

Then I stopped going. (Dammit, they had Blue Man Group in 2000!) After that:

Yanni
Mannheim Steamroller (just last month)

I don’t go to concerts much. 1996-1999 was a rare exception.

Read full topic

item.title: Concerts/Live Music
item.dc:creator: Elpants
item.description:
We have a now playing thread, but what about live music aka the best kind? A place to discuss their favorite live bands/musicians, shows seen live, and any upcoming tours.

I guess I can start off.

I have seen a few bands live, Pretty much all after I graduated High School and moved to a city that bands bother coming near.

Seen: (trying to stay in order, my favorites are in BOLD
Goatwhore
The Acacia Strain
The Devil Wears Prada
The Number 12 Looks Like You
Amon Amarth (met them after the show and had them sign my concert booklet)
Darkest Hour (met them with Amon Amarth)
Chimaira (Twice)
Job For a Cowboy (Three times, terrible each time)
Every Time I Die
Shadows Fall
Gwar
Light This City
The Deep
All That Remains (Twice)
[b]Animosity /b
First Blood
For the Fallen Dreams
All Shall Perish
Hate Eternal
Veil of Maya
Beneath The Massacre
Dying Fetus
Necrophagist
Divine Heresy
As I Lay Dying (Twice)
August Burns Red
Annotations of an Autopsy
Evergreen Terrace
36 Crazy Fists
Trivium (Probably the WORST band I have ever seen, I walked out)
The Human Abstract (Twice)
Protest The Hero
MyChildren MyBride
Opeth
Enslaved
Clutch
Baroness (my buddy and I were probably the only 2 people at the show who knew who Baroness were.)
Lionize
No Quarter (Led Zepplin tribute band)
Obscura
Neuraxis
The Faceless (twice)
Cannibal Corpse (I am the proud owner of a drum stick thrown into the crowd during the encore)
3 Inches of Blood
Between the Buried and Me
In Flames
Torche
The Dillinger Escape Plan

Best show was probably the Opeth and Enslaved show last spring. The black metal band Wolves in the Throne Room showed up and were set to play but they couldn’t fit their set list in with the time constraints. I got to meet them otherwise, the show blew my mind.

Upcoming shows:
Just bought my ticket the other day for:
Megadeth, Testament and Exodus. Show is in March.

Read full topic
